H0.text: Help digest food is the most important function of enzymes in animals.

H1.text: Carry oxygen is the most important function of enzymes in animals.

H2.text: Transport messages is the most important function of enzymes in animals.

H3.text: Excrete waste is the most important function of enzymes in animals.

A4.text: Enzymes such as amylases and proteases break down large molecules (starch or proteins, respectively) into smaller ones, so they can be absorbed by the intestines.

A5.text: In ruminants, which have herbivorous diets, microorganisms in the gut produce another enzyme, cellulase, to break down the cellulose cell walls of plant fiber.
